citations.narrative:
A search was conducted at the facility and when interviewed, the facility owner admitted that dog sales were conducted
without face-to-face interaction. The facility owner disclosed that she has more than four breeding females and conducted
internet sales of animals with shipment of animals to the purchasers. The licensee does not meet any exceptions or
exemptions for the requirement for licensure under the Animal Welfare Act. According to Animal Care records and by the
admission of the owner, an Animal Care inspector contacted the owner 8/16/2021. She was made aware of the need to
be licensed and was provided with an application kit by USDA. However, she has not applied for a license and is currently
not licensed.
Conducting regulated activity without a USDA license does not comply with the Animal Welfare Act or ensure that APHIS
officials can assess the care of the animals. Continuing to conduct regulated activity without a license is a serious
violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
Correct by promptly submitting an application for license by 12/04/24 and do not conduct any regulated activities until a
USDA license/registration is obtained.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.1(a)(1)  Critical
   
Requirements and application. 
A search was conducted at the facility and when interviewed, the facility owner admitted that dog sales were conducted 
without face-to-face interaction. The facility owner disclosed that she has more than four breeding females and conducted 
internet sales of animals with shipment of animals to the purchasers. The licensee does not meet any exceptions or 
exemptions for the requirement for licensure under the Animal Welfare Act. According to Animal Care records and by the 
admission of the owner, an Animal Care inspector contacted the owner 8/16/2021. She was made aware of the need to 
be licensed and was provided with an application kit by USDA. However, she has not applied for a license and is currently 
not licensed. 
 
Conducting regulated activity without a USDA license does not comply with the Animal Welfare Act or ensure that APHIS 
officials can assess the care of the animals. Continuing to conduct regulated activity without a license is a serious 
violation of the Animal Welfare Act.  
Correct by promptly submitting an application for license by 12/04/24 and do not conduct any regulated activities until a 
USDA license/registration is obtained. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
